description: From Old English ēarlæppa. Equivalent to ear +‎ lap.

examples: ...of boring the Earlap, which is performed in Germany, not merely for the purpose of inserting earrings, but as a method of counter-irritation in ophthalmic diseases

entries.meaning: A flap connected to headgear to protect the ear (against the cold, or physical harm); an earflap.
examples: Everyone looked over at Shevchuk, who was shifting from one foot to the other, rumpling his well-traveled hat with its missing earlap
